item.title: Pothole with raised ironwork, Swindon Roaf, 13th June
item.description:
The road surface has eroded badly around the manhole cover creating deep pothole and uneven surfaces. Thus is close to the centre of the road, opposite 308/310 Swindon Road, near the Maudâ€™s Elm roundabout

item.title: Manhole cover rattles every time a vehicle goes over and the building shakes if it is a truck. Getting worse every day., 13th June
item.description:
On the westbound carriageway between 402 and 400A Gloucester Road. Issue has been present for a few months but is getting progressively worse. If not fixed soon, damage will likely get worse.

item.title: Abandoned vehicle, 13th June
item.description:
This van has been parked here for about 6 weeks not moving and is clearly abandoned. The vehicle belongs to a local company so why they have abandoned it here I don't know.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 74, Leckhampton Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham

item.title: Road in very poor condition, 13th June
item.description:
And has been deteriorating for months. Have to swerve to avoid it. Please can it be repaired.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 31, Leckhampton Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: W&W works blocking one side of Everest Road, 13th June
item.description:
This leads to people mounting the pavement to avoid collisions. I witnessed a driver reverse, narrowly avoiding pedestrians attempting to cross the road behind them, because a car was coming the other way. Cyclists, pedestrians and drivers alike are in danger because this road is entirely blocked and there's no way to see round the blockage. No work is being undertaken at this area apart from a big hole being fenced off several weeks ago. Repeated reports to W&W have led to absolutely nothing. Traffic management needs to be put in place before someone is hurt. It doesn't help that vehicles are parking behind this, sometimes on the double yellows, which makes it even more of a hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 38, Everest Road, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Over hanging branches into property and weeds all down the alleyway, 13th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pirton Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury

item.title: Dumped car, 13th June
item.description:
Car has been dumped in this parking bay for several weeks now. Covered in tickets of some description but not actually parking tickets which says no ticket inspectors come up this way!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Vittoria Walk, Montpellier, Cheltenham

item.title: It would seem that this hole should be replaced with a stone or cement type material block. Previously there was a large blob of tarmac fitted there. -it has been left on the side of the road next to the trunk of the large tree, 13th June
item.description:
This hole is at the left hand corner of Priory Place (see 2 views as per photos) where it meets London Road. It is potentially dangerous for cyclists exiting Priory Place and the lack of material there will not id the longevity of the edge of the tarmac on London Road. This has only been a problem since the resurfacing of London Road this year.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Priory Place, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole not fixed properly!!!!, 13th June
item.description:
This pothole has been fixed at least 3 times and every time the work is rubbish, beyond a joke. You had the cheek to email that you fixed this on 05/06/2025, well it's not been fixed, same as the last time you came along chucked some grit in it and then left with a smug smile on your face of a job not well done. How many times can you mess up filling a hole in the ground!???? Send a real inspector to look at what our taxes are being wasted on, this is beyond a joke!!!!!!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 54, Elm Street, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 17 Belland Drive, rotting caravan on drive, 13th June
item.description:
17 Belland Drive. Caravan been left and not used for years.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 26, Belland Drive, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging Branches Damaging Motor Home, 13th June
item.description:
As you enter the Old Stoke Road immediately on your left are some over hanging branches. As a resident I use this route every day in my car, however, on Wednesday I drove my daughters brand new Motor Home on the same line and hit the overhanging branches which damaged paintwork and windows. Will attempt to remove marks ourselves but please can you cut trees back asap, Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stoke Orchard Road, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Badgeworth Road, The Reddings, Cheltenham

item.title: The Grange Estate, cleansing and weed killing needed, 12th June
item.description:
Brunel Drive, Castle Close, Wickham Grove and Cinder Close on The Grange Estate in Gotherington needs the highway and footpaths cleansing and weeds removing from the herb edged and footpaths. I believe it is two years since being adopted and has not been cleansed at all since adoption.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Brunel Drive, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lyndley Chase junction On to Stoke Orchard Road, 12th June
item.description:
The exit coming out of Lyndley Chase on to Stoke Orchard Road is obscured by long grass. This has Been reported a while ago and is getting worse. An accident waiting to happen!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stoke Orchard Road, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain cover missing, 12th June
item.description:
Drain cover has fallen in again and now the cone that's in it has been hit many times, been thrown in the bushes so drivers don't know there's a gaping hole there, basically the same cycle over and over. Needs fixing as somone on a bike or car, horse riders etc will be injured if they go in it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Andoversford, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cats driving through pedestrian green light, 12th June
item.description:
So many cars are turning right after their light turns red that they drive through the pedestrian crossing when the green light is lit. I've just crossed here and two cars drove through when the green pedestrian light was showing. I am thankfully funny sighted otherwise I have no doubt I would have been knocked down
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 109-111, Bath Road, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
